ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.2_0: On one occasion in Rājagaha there was a hilltop fair,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.3_0: and the monks from the group of seventeen went to see it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.4_0: When people saw the monks, they bathed them, anointed them, fed them staples, and gave them non-staple food.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.5_0: The monks brought that food back to the monastery. And they said to the monks from the group of six,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.7_0: “But where did you get this food?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.9_0: “So are you eating at the wrong time?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.11_0: The monks from the group of six complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.12_0: “How can those monks from the group of seventeen eat at the wrong time?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.14_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.15_0: “How can those monks from the group of seventeen eat at the wrong time?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.16_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.19_0: “... Foolish men, how can you eat at the wrong time?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.20_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.21_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:1.22.1_0: ‘If a monk eats staple or non-staple food at the wrong time, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.6_0: when the middle of the day has passed, until dawn.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.8_0: apart from the five staple foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—the rest is called “non-staple food”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.10_0: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.11_0: If he receives staple or non-staple food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.1.12_0: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.1_0: If it is the wrong time, and he perceives it as such, and he eats staple or non-staple food, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.2_0: If it is the wrong time, but he is unsure of it, and he eats staple or non-staple food, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.3_0: If it is the wrong time, but he perceives it as the right time, and he eats staple or non-staple food, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.4_0: If he receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.5_0: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.6_0: If it is the right time, but he perceives it as the wrong time, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.7_0: If it is the right time, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.2.8_0: If it is the right time, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.3.2_0: if, when there is a reason, he uses post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.3.4_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc37:2.3.5_0: The seventh rule, the training rule on eating at the wrong time, is finished.
